column4: uh, I'm not sure what I need to understand? I got your pm but my script is full of lines that only differ as far as the filename is concerned
the lines are simply cp /my/mp3/collection/Some Song.mp3"  thedirectoryinwhichiwantthem
i've just tried to make an absolutely trivial copying script by search and replacing a playlist
and the filenames constitute the problem since they have spaces
are you quoting the paths that have spaces?
what editor did you use to write it?
do this: cat -e thescript and paste a sample line here
cat -e thescript   and paste a sample line here.
see the ^M , thats a carriage return used in windows line-endings
so you are copying the files to a file name '\r'  (carriage return), which ls shows as '?'
after you do that, cat -e thescript and you should no longer see ^M
thanks! it works now (apart from some upper/lower case mess since it's a very old winamp playlist)
did you read the filenames off a winamp playlist?
because that could do it. otherwise, you must have used a windows text editor somewhere along the way.
thanks once again for your help, gotta go
